message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you the exclusive opportunity to acquire this truly unique product. Given its immense value and potential, I'm confident it will exceed your expectations. I'm proposing a starting price of $1,800,000. What are your thoughts?
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I believe it's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer, but $1,200,000 undervalues the product significantly.  Let's find a middle ground - how about $1,600,000?  This reflects its true worth while still offering you a competitive price.
I appreciate your understanding, but I'm afraid $1,200,000 is my maximum offer. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet at this price.

Bob, I understand you have a limit, but I'm also confident you recognize the exceptional value of this product.  Walking away would mean missing out for both of us. How about we meet halfway at $1,400,000? This is my final offer.
I'm afraid I've already made it clear that $1,200,000 is my maximum offer. I'm not willing to go any higher. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
